page.title: 16ROAD STRUCTURE IN TADLEY
page.content: One of the greatest sources of anger, both in Tadley and the rural areas, is the ever increasing amount of traffic. In Tadley there has been a great deal of housing development but very little thought given to road planning, with many of the estates having poor access to the busy main road. While in the country, narrow, winding lanes are unable to cope with all the heavy local traffic going to the AWRE mixing with commuter traffic. In Tadley and in the country there are cries for more speed limits and for the enforcement of those that already exist. The police say that this is impossible, and that the very nature of many of the roads should prevent excessive speeding. Residents know that this is not true.
